snippet: Exploiting generous benefits and loopholes, some public sector employees are earning more than $260,000 in a year.
abstract: So-called 'super salaries' that some public employees in Brazil receive are feeding newfound resentment over inequality in nation's unwieldy bureaucracies; some public sector employees earn more than $260,000 per year by exploiting generous benefits and loopholes.

byline.contributor: Lis Horta Moriconi and Taylor Barnes contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro.

lead_paragraph: Exploiting generous benefits and loopholes, some public sector employees are earning more than $260,000 in a year.

headline.seo: Brazil Seethes Over Public Officials’ ‘Super Salaries’
headline.main: Brazil, Where a Judge Made $361,500 in a Month, Fumes Over Pay
